title: ‘Every single cage is full’: Nearly 100 cats rescued from Rhode Island hoarding situation
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Rhode Island SPCA rescued 97 cats from a hoarding situation in a 1200-square-foot Woonsocket apartment.
Some cats are pregnant, and many have colds requiring treatment; they are undersocialized and need care.
The shelter seeks donations of supplies and monetary help via Venmo or PayPal for the rescued cats.

title: What Jarren Duran said of trade rumors, reps at DH with Red Sox
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jarren Duran may see more time as a designated hitter due to the Red Sox's outfield surplus.
Despite trade rumors, Duran remains unconcerned, stating he doesn't pay attention to speculation about his future.
Duran, 29, reflects on a slight performance decline last season, determined to improve in 2026.

title: Bruins’ Jordan Harris looking to make hockey more accessible, inclusive in Mass.
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jordan Harris is hosting a clinic at Warrior Ice Arena as part of his Harris' Huskies program.
Harris' program collaborates with SCORE Boston, a nonprofit supporting to make hockey accessible to underprivileged youth.
The initiative provides equipment, ice time, and clinics, backed by the NHL, Boston Bruins Foundation, and other sponsors.

title: When will Jayson Tatum return for Celtics? Bill Simmons makes his prediction.
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jayson Tatum's return from an Achilles tendon injury is speculated to be around March 1 or March 6.
NBC's national broadcast of Celtics vs. Sixers on March 1 suggests Tatum's potential return correlates with their docuseries on him.
Bill Simmons predicts Tatum's return based on practice progress and network broadcasts, seeing March 1 as a likely date.

title: State Police trooper seriously injured after cruiser hit on North Shore highway
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: State Police trooper seriously injured after his SUV was struck on I-95 South in Salisbury.
Josue Levi Cuevas Santana, 24, identified as the driver and faces multiple charges, including negligent operation and speeding.
Trooper was released from Portsmouth Regional Hospital on Feb. 15 and is recovering at home.

title: Fleet goalie Aerin Frankel sets Olympic record, helps Team USA advance to gold-medal game
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Aerin Frankel made Olympic history with three shutouts in women's hockey, aiding Team USA's 5-0 win over Sweden.
Team USA women's hockey reached the gold-medal game, maintaining a shutout streak of 331:23 with Aerin Frankel's crucial contributions.
Frankel, part of Boston Fleet, holds a .985 save percentage in Olympics and .946 in PWHL season, helping Team USA excel.

title: Woman found dead, search for husband suspended after couple falls through ice in Eastham, officials say
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A woman died after falling through ice at First Encounter Beach in Eastham on February 14, officials reported.
Search efforts for her missing husband were suspended after a six-hour initial search failed to locate him.
The Eastham Fire and Police Departments continue to monitor conditions for resuming the search for the missing man.

title: ‘Just pick up a glove’: Tom Werner was disappointed in Rafael Devers saga
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Rafael Devers was traded from the Red Sox to the Giants in June after a contentious period over position play.
Red Sox chairman Tom Werner expressed frustration with Devers' refusal to play first base after an injury vacancy.
Red Sox officials admitted they might have handled Devers' position concerns differently leading to his trade.

title: What Sam Kennedy said about Bregman, Devers, and ‘hurtful’ narrative about Red Sox
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Sam Kennedy defended the Red Sox's commitment to winning amid criticism after trading Rafael Devers and losing Alex Bregman.
Kennedy admitted the team could have better managed Devers, who was disgruntled before his midseason trade to San Francisco.
Kennedy addressed spending criticism, highlighting a $256.1 million payroll, seventh-highest in MLB, showing ownership's commitment.

title: 3 dead, 3 injured in shooting at R.I. high school hockey game, mayor calls shooting ‘targeted family dispute’
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Three people were killed, including the shooter, and three critically injured in a shooting at a Pawtucket hockey game.
Mayor Donald Grebien described the shooting as a 'targeted family dispute'; the shooter had a self-inflicted fatal wound.
Authorities identified the shooter as Robert Dorgan and are investigating the incident with Rhode Island State Police involvement.
